the only thing it does...is show a lighted level display when there is soun=
d soooo you plug your recorder in (digital) and when you speak you see the =
level moves when your quite and you see the same level go up when no one is=
 speaking it suppose to inform you that you have a evp. I guess this is for=
 one the stop so to speak checking..not rocket science or anything it don't=
 suppose to make evp better or anything like that...it is what it is..

---=
 On Sat, 1/8/11, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@...> wrote:


From: Zack Widup=
 <w9sz.zack@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Hi everyone..does anyone know=
 anything about this device?
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Saturday, Ja=
nuary 8, 2011, 11:08 AM


=C2=A0 



Yeah, when I saw the price it turned m=
e off.

I don't quite "grok" how the thing is supposed to work. How does it=

know it's getting an EVP? The only way I really know of is to LISTEN.
Some=
 of the EVP's I and others have gotten are so close to the noise
level that=
 it takes a little noise floor manipulation to hear them.

Zack

On 1/8/11,=
 Mvanah Maloti <inyanga4@...> wrote:
> It looks like a cool toy, but =
I'm not sure it would make a whole ton of
> difference in one's results, it=
 might even detract from them. Others mileage
> & opinions may differ, natu=
rally.
>
> It seems this device is trying to establish a very loose set of =
"controls"
> for capturing and validating EVP, but in my opinion this is th=
e WRONG thing
> to do in some ways...I think "they" need anomalies, fluctua=
tions and
> variable conditions for the best communication possible (someth=
ing box-work
> provides them, and abundantly at that!).
>
> Since working w=
ith the boxes I don't think I could ever go back to white
> noise EVP and b=
e happy; the sweeping radio is just too effective and light
> years ahead o=
f what folks were doing even just 10-12 years (and
> months!) ago, I feel.
=
>
> Where the sweeping radio functions more like a proper telephone (2 way)=
,
> traditional EVP just feels like I might as well try tying two tin cans
=
> together with a string between them and hoping for something useful or
> =
interesting to be captured or come through.
>
> Box work just feels a lot m=
ore proactive and effective to me in every way,
> shape and form. I can't t=
hink of a single advantage that classical EVP
> recording & research has or=
 could offer one over the boxes. The skeptics are
> still going to bitch, m=
oan and continue "debunking" both EVP and Ghost Box
> communication either =
way and that's fine with me, I don't work for them and
> I'm not trying to =
convince anybody, lol.
>
> $135.00 could get me another FLIP! ;)
>
> -J
>
>=
